column4: does anyone have experience installing pine on ubuntu x86_64?

couldn't get flash to work and not many third party packages are available... and personally NO WAY I feel a difference compared to i386
ah, that's nice to hear. Care to share with me how I can do it?
the flash player thing can be a real pain
thanks for the info, but I was referring to installing the program pine on a 64 bit system :)
Oh It should work man...
how do I set the users to login my box without a password (no need for security here)...
unfortunately there's only a 32 bit .deb available
oh that's the issue...LOL
and sudo dpkg -i --force-architecture does not seem to work
that's what I am saying...
a couple of things will never work... at least for now...
do you have the 32 bit libs?
the 32 bit libs, do you have it?
not sure
do you use SKYPE?
I'll see what errors I get
no :)
they have a tutorial which they tell you to install a huge amount of 32 bit libraries..

with force-architecture
